publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7632 Alasdair Allan: NY2SY—That the Parliament supports the Stornoway-based Gaelic broadcaster, Niall Iain MacDonald, in his bid to row solo across the Atlantic from New York to Stornoway in May 2011, a distance of some 3,400 miles, in a journey that is expected to last three months and the first time that such a route has been attempted; notes that Niall Iain is attempting to raise funds for the Scottish Association for Mental Health and that all those who wish to support him and to donate can do so online at www.ny2sy.co.uk, and wishes him all the best in his challenge and a safe journey home to Stornoway. Supported by: Mary Scanlon*, Jim Hume*, Bill Kidd*, Jamie McGrigor*, Kenneth Gibson*, Jim Tolson*
S3M-7632 NY2SY (lodged on 20 December 2010) Liam McArthur*, Gil Paterson*
S3M-7632 NY2SY (lodged on 20 December 2010) Stuart McMillan*, Jamie Hepburn*, Sandra White*

S3M-7632 Alasdair Allan: NY2SY—That the Parliament supports the Stornoway-based Gaelic broadcaster, Niall Iain MacDonald, in his bid to row solo across the Atlantic from New York to Stornoway in May 2011, a distance of some 3,400 miles, in a journey that is expected to last three months and the first time that such a route has been attempted; notes that Niall Iain is attempting to raise funds for the Scottish Association for Mental Health and that all those who wish to support him and to donate can do so online at www.ny2sy.co.uk, and wishes him all the best in his challenge and a safe journey home to Stornoway. Supported by: Mary Scanlon, Jim Hume, Bill Kidd, Jamie McGrigor, Kenneth Gibson, Jim Tolson, Liam McArthur, Gil Paterson, Stuart McMillan, Jamie Hepburn, Sandra White
S3M-7632 NY2SY (lodged on 20 December 2010) Robin Harper*, Hugh Henry*
S3M-7632 NY2SY (lodged on 20 December 2010) Shirley-Anne Somerville*
